Posted By: stygimoloch (12/2/2008 5:32:52 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I think I got these for about a buck each at a local card shop around when Mirrodin was first released. Probably the most valuable playset I own O.o. Unfortunately I can't afford the truly awesome cards that break the stick, like [Orim's Chant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Orim's Chant). Instead, I use it in a wonky U/W control deck whose win condition is [Dampen Thought](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dampen Thought) spliced onto a sticked [Ethereal Haze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ethereal Haze), with [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell) backup. It's possibly the most unfun deck to play against ever, which I didn't really think about when putting it together. Either my opponent kills me before I stabilize and the game ends quickly and unremarkably, or I do stabilize and we sit around for about 10 turns while I slowly mill him to death. Yet, I still get a kick out of doing it. Does that make me a bad person?
posts.html:
